text.__SUMMARY__:
Grevillea berryana is a small tree or shrub of the genus Grevillea native to Pilbara, Mid West and Goldfields regions of Western Australia.The small tree or shrub typically grows to a height of 1.5 to 8 metres (5 to 26 ft) and has non-glaucous branchlets. It has simple leaves found dorsiventral 6 to 20 centimetres (2 to 8 in) in length. The erect conflorescence has 2 to 6 branches with pale cream to yellow flowers.
